description.para: Converts a time value to a string and adjust for local time zone settings.

return.para: Each of these functions returns a pointer to the character string result. If time represents a date before midnight, January 1, 1970, UTC, the function returns NULL.

remarks.para: The ctime function converts a time value stored as a time_t structure into a character string. The timer value is usually obtained from a call to time. The string result produced by ctime contains exactly 26 characters and has the form:

A 24-hour clock is used. All fields have a constant width. The newline character ('\n') and the null character ('\0') occupy the last two positions of the string. _wctime is a wide-character version of ctime; _wctime returns a pointer to a wide-character string.
Parameter timer must not be NULL.
